subject: Mathematics
description: Interpret products of whole numbers (e.g., 3 × 5 as total objects in 3 groups of 5).

subject: Mathematics
description: Use multiplication and division within 100 to solve word problems in situations involving equal groups and arrays.

subject: Mathematics
domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
description: Fluently add and subtract within 1000 using place value strategies and properties of operations.

subject: Mathematics
description: Understand a fraction 1/b as one part of a whole divided into b equal parts and a/b as the quantity formed by a parts of size 1/b.

subject: Mathematics
description: Explain equivalence of fractions and compare fractions by reasoning about their size.

subject: Mathematics
description: Draw scaled picture and bar graphs to represent a data set and solve problems using the information presented.

subject: Mathematics
description: Understand that shapes in different categories may share attributes that define larger categories (e.g., quadrilaterals).

subject: Mathematics
description: Solve multistep word problems posed with whole numbers using the four operations and interpret remainders.

subject: Mathematics
domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
description: Fluently add and subtract multi-digit whole numbers using the standard algorithm.

subject: Mathematics
description: Understand a fraction a/b with a > 1 as a sum of fractions 1/b.

subject: Mathematics
description: Compare two decimals to hundredths using >, =, and < and justify the conclusions.

subject: Mathematics
description: Apply the area and perimeter formulas for rectangles in real-world and mathematical problems.

subject: Mathematics
description: Classify two-dimensional figures based on the presence or absence of parallel or perpendicular lines and angles.

subject: Mathematics
domain: Number and Operations in Base Ten
description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths using place value strategies and properties of operations.

subject: Mathematics
description: Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators by replacing given fractions with equivalent fractions.

subject: Mathematics
description: Interpret a fraction as division of the numerator by the denominator.

subject: Mathematics
description: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication to multiply a fraction or whole number by a fraction.

subject: Mathematics
description: Relate volume to multiplication and addition and solve real-world and mathematical problems involving volume.

subject: Mathematics
description: Use a coordinate plane to represent points and interpret their meaning in the context of a problem.

subject: Mathematics
description: Understand that attributes belonging to a category of two-dimensional figures also belong to all subcategories of that category.

subject: Mathematics
description: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

subject: Mathematics
description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world and mathematical problems including unit rate.

subject: Mathematics
description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers and interpret statements of inequality.

subject: Mathematics
description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems by writing and solving equations of the form x + p = q and px = q.

subject: Mathematics
description: Use variables to represent two quantities in a relationship; analyze the relationship using graphs, tables, and equations.

subject: Mathematics
description: Find the area of right triangles, other triangles, special quadrilaterals, and polygons by composing into rectangles and triangles.

subject: Mathematics
description: Display numerical data in plots on a number line, including dot plots, histograms, and box plots.

subject: Mathematics
description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to their context, including measures of center and variability.

subject: Mathematics
description: Recognize and represent proportional relationships between quantities.

subject: Mathematics
description: Apply and extend previous understandings of addition and subtraction to add and subtract rational numbers.

subject: Mathematics
description: Apply and extend multiplication and division of fractions to multiply and divide rational numbers.

subject: Mathematics
description: Solve multistep real-life and mathematical problems posed with positive and negative rational numbers.

subject: Mathematics
description: Solve word problems leading to equations of the form px + q = r and p(x + q) = r, assessing the reasonableness of results.

subject: Mathematics
description: Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving area, volume, and surface area of two- and three-dimensional objects.

subject: Mathematics
description: Develop a probability model and use it to find probabilities of events.

subject: Mathematics
description: Know that numbers that are not rational are called irrational and understand rational approximations of irrational numbers.

subject: Mathematics
description: Use square root and cube root symbols to represent solutions to equations of the form x^2 = p and x^3 = p.

subject: Mathematics
description: Graph proportional relationships and compare linear relationships by examining slope.

subject: Mathematics
description: Analyze and solve pairs of simultaneous linear equations.

subject: Mathematics
description: Understand that a function assigns to each input exactly one output and describe functions by their rules or graphs.

subject: Mathematics
description: Construct a function to model a linear relationship between two quantities; interpret rate of change and initial value.

subject: Mathematics
description: Explain a proof of the Pythagorean Theorem and its converse.

subject: Mathematics
description: Construct and interpret scatter plots for bivariate measurement data to investigate patterns of association.

subject: Mathematics
description: Use the equation of a fitted line to model the linear relationship between two quantities and assess fit.
